translation.en: I remember one of the first times we went surfing.
translation.ja: 最初のサーフィンの時―

translation.en: And Garret, he had a little surfboard and I had a board,
translation.ja: ギャレットに 小さなボードを持たせた

translation.en: and I... helped him catch a wave, and he really liked it.
translation.ja: 私が波に乗る方法を教えて 息子は楽しんでたよ

translation.en: He just caught on right away.
translation.ja: すぐコツを得た

translation.en: So, I had instilled a love for the ocean for him.
translation.ja: 私が海の魅力を教えたんだ

translation.en: We would go fishing and things like that.
translation.ja: 釣りにも行った

translation.en: Couple years ago, I told him that we bought a lot in Mexico
translation.ja: 数年前にメキシコで 土地を買ったんだ

translation.en: uh, that is like five minutes away from the water.
translation.ja: 海から５分の距離だ

translation.en: Uh, it's a world- class surf spot,
translation.ja: サーフィンの名所

translation.en: And I want to give it to you. He goes, What? You know, and he got all excited,
translation.ja: その土地をギャレットに 譲ると伝えた

translation.en: and he was really, really, uh... happy to hear that.
translation.ja: それを聞いた息子は もちろん大喜びしたよ

translation.en: And I says, Look, but you have to earn enough money
translation.ja: でも小屋は 自分の稼ぎで建てることを―

translation.en: to put up a little house on there.
translation.ja: 譲る条件とした

translation.en: I says, So, the sooner that you get the money, the sooner you can have it, you know.
translation.ja: “早く建てれば 早く土地が手に入る”

translation.en: So he said, Okay, Dad.
translation.ja: そう伝えた

translation.en: He got a job on a long- range fishing boat.
translation.ja: 息子は遠洋漁業の仕事を得た

translation.en: And then right about a week or so before he was supposed to leave,
translation.ja: でも出発の１週間前に―

translation.en: he calls me, and he says, Dad, I decided not to go.
translation.ja: 行くのをやめたと 連絡が来たんだ

translation.en: I says, Why not? He says, Because I know where I can make more money in a lesser amount of time.
translation.ja: もっと短期間で 稼げる手段を見つけたと言う

translation.en: And I says, Where? He says, Up in the medical marijuana fields up in Northern California.
translation.ja: 医療用大麻畑での 仕事だと言うから―

translation.en: And I said, No, son. Don't even get involved with that, please.
translation.ja: もちろん私は やめるように懇願したよ

translation.en: Humboldt, for people that don't know what we are all about, is...
translation.ja: ハンボルトを よく知らない人は―

translation.en: always been known as an outlaw community.
translation.ja: 無法地帯だと思ってる

translation.en: You say, Oh, yeah, I'm from Humboldt County,
translation.ja: ハンボルト出身と 聞くと―

translation.en: and people go, Oh. Okay.

translation.en: Usually that's a wink- wink, nudge- nudge,

translation.en: say- no- more situation where, um...
translation.ja: サイラス･アレン 農場経営者 そして それ以上 言及しない そして それ以上 言及しない

translation.en: they're assuming that you're just a pot grower, that that's all you're really all about.

translation.en: What allured me, and I know a lot of people, I think it's the freedom.
translation.ja: この仕事の魅力は 自由であることだ

translation.en: I think it was the idea of living in the great outdoors, off the grid, being self- sufficient. That type of thing.

translation.en: Things that are harmless, really.

translation.en: It's alarming.

translation.ja: 〝行方不明〞 〝行方不明〞 保安官と民間捜索隊は今も―

translation.ja: 彼女が当時乗ってた車から 川までの道のりを―

translation.en: They deal with a lot of things that other counties don't have to deal with.

translation.en: But I think being able to, you know,

translation.en: at least return that child to his parents.

translation.en: I think as a parent, not knowing, you know, where your child is...

translation.en: to be on the lookout for our missing person and to contact the sheriff's office.

translation.ja: 失踪者が多いのは―

translation.en: So you already have a culture of people who kind of want to disappear.

translation.en: A lot of the public opinion out there

translation.en: It makes you kind of think, what if this guy came up here because he could get away with this?

translation.en: You know?

translation.en: That narrative is flashy and attractive and misleading.

translation.en: I- I do not-- If I knew, then I guess these wouldn't be unsolved cases.

translation.ja: 情報が寄せられてるそうね

translation.ja: 不確かな情報はね

translation.en: No. I did have a girl, the other day,

translation.en: and that made me feel really good.
translation.ja: 勇気づけられたわ

translation.en: I can imagine.

translation.ja: 〝目撃者求む〞 公的機関の対応はどう？

translation.en: The local law enforcement, um...
translation.ja: 地元警察は…

translation.en: yeah, it's a tricky...

translation.en: and they would lend me an ear at any time of the day or night.

translation.en: And you realize that it's really up to you, the individual family member...

translation.en: ...to lead the charge.

translation.en: I believe that's because they have so many reports of missing people.

translation.en: There are so many missing persons in Humboldt County that law enforcement cannot possibly keep up with it.

translation.en: Within the sheriff's department,

translation.en: a lot of times the missing persons detective
translation.ja: 保安官事務所で 多くの場合 失踪担当は― 〝郡裁判所〞 保安官事務所で 多くの場合 失踪担当は―

translation.en: is also a homicide detective.
translation.ja: 殺人事件担当でもある

translation.ja: 年間１万２千の調書を この記録管理局で処理してる

translation.en: And missing persons cases, crime reports, those kind of things.
translation.ja: 行方不明者の情報も 犯罪記録も

translation.en: I did have a question, as somebody who looks at a lot of crime and missing person cases.
translation.ja: 失踪者を捜すのに 多くの人員を動かすより―

translation.en: Wouldn't it be easier to have one dude who looks at all these missing people rather than just spending it out, and...

translation.en: You know, it all depends, because a voluntary missing person...

translation.en: You know, we have our detective bureau
translation.ja: ウィリアム･ホンサル ハンボルト郡保安官 場合によるよ 自発的な失踪者もいる それも捜索するが とにかく件数が多い

translation.en: that looks at these cases, and we have a caseload.
translation.ja: それも捜索するが とにかく件数が多い

translation.en: The problem is, when you have, you know, 20 homicides in a year, some of those things get pushed to the side.

translation.en: And it's an important thing for us to do, absolutely,

translation.en: but we also, with the limited resources we have, we have to prioritize, you know.
translation.ja: だが人手は有限だ 優先順位はある

translation.en: And also, people have to work with us.
translation.ja: 市民と協力するのも重要だ

translation.en: Especially in southern Humboldt, if there's a problem,
translation.ja: 南ハンボルトでは 問題を抱えてても―

translation.en: they can't go to law enforcement,

translation.en: because their lifestyle

translation.en: unless you have a permit, which those are few and far between even now.

translation.en: What we are finding is that missing persons
translation.ja: この郡で失踪者が 見つかりづらいのは― この郡で失踪者が 見つかりづらいのは― リンダ･スタンズベリー 北岸ジャーナル 記者

translation.en: are very difficult to find in Humboldt County.
translation.ja: この郡で失踪者が 見つかりづらいのは― リンダ･スタンズベリー 北岸ジャーナル 記者 リンダ･スタンズベリー 北岸ジャーナル 記者 リンダ･スタンズベリー 北岸ジャーナル 記者 だいたい大麻産業が 原因となってる だいたい大麻産業が 原因となってる

translation.en: And a lot of that is tied back into the cannabis industry.
translation.ja: だいたい大麻産業が 原因となってる

translation.en: A harvest is a really big deal, because you're thinking,
translation.ja: 収穫期は達成感に満ちる

translation.en: We made it this far. There's one last chance that we're going to get busted.
translation.ja: もう見つかることを 恐れる必要もないし

translation.en: A trimmer, or trimmigrant, would be anybody who comes to Humboldt
translation.ja: 〝収穫移民〞は― マリオン･コラマー 農場経営者 稼ぐため 収穫期に この郡に来る人のこと

translation.en: specifically to make money during harvest trimming.
translation.ja: マリオン･コラマー 農場経営者 稼ぐため 収穫期に この郡に来る人のこと

translation.en: When I first started trimming, it was just hippie girls, mostly.
translation.ja: 最初の頃は ヒッピーの女子だけ

translation.en: All the trimmers were women.
translation.ja: 男子禁制だった

translation.en: Mostly because Greg used to say, and I agree, that guys eat more, they drink more, and they sleep more.
translation.ja: グレッグが言うには 男はよく食べるし飲むから

translation.en: Also, usually a hippie girl wouldn't come back and rob you.
translation.ja: 女子なら強盗する可能性も 低くなるし

translation.en: But her boyfriend would.

translation.en: Spicy.

translation.en: - Look. - That's awesome!

translation.en: dignity.

translation.ja: うん

translation.en: I have hid in the woods with my children when I was pregnant
translation.ja: 妊娠中は森に隠れてた

translation.en: while the helicopters totally circled.
translation.ja: いつも上空でヘリが 飛び回ってたから

translation.en: Daddy can't-- Daddy said they're probably broken.
translation.ja: もうダメだって

translation.en: What are you losing?
translation.ja: どれが？

translation.en: I feel we're gonna lose a little bit of our community, our sense of what makes Humboldt Humboldt.
translation.ja: でもハンボルト特有の 連帯感は失うと思う

translation.en: This is the last outlaw harvest, yeah.
translation.ja: 今回が最後の違法な収穫

translation.en: When it comes down to making a decision whether...
translation.ja: 信号が 赤になろうとしてる時―

translation.en: you're going to stop when the lights are flashing behind you,
translation.ja: 人は止まったり進んだりする でもアウトローは―

translation.en: or if that means go.
translation.ja: でもアウトローは―

translation.en: An outlaw always chooses go.
translation.ja: 必ず進む

translation.en: People think that a change in the dynamic of the marketplace
translation.ja: 一部の人は第64法案で アウトローの無鉄砲に―

translation.en: that Prop 64 is gonna bring is gonna be able to...
translation.ja: 一部の人は第64法案で アウトローの無鉄砲に― 一部の人は第64法案で アウトローの無鉄砲に― オースティン 闇市場の栽培者 オースティン 闇市場の栽培者

translation.en: stop the people with that kind of tenacity...
translation.ja: オースティン 闇市場の栽培者 歯止めをかけられると 思ってる 歯止めをかけられると 思ってる

translation.en: then I don't think they have the slightest clue on what goes on in this county.
translation.ja: 実態を理解してないゆえの 思い違いだ

translation.en: Well, since arriving here, I've been shot at,
translation.ja: ここに来てから撃たれたり 殴られたり―

translation.en: I've been beaten, I've been kidnapped three times.
translation.ja: ここに来てから撃たれたり 殴られたり― ３度 誘拐されたり

translation.en: Had a gun shoved in my mouth, tied to a chair. Kicked down a flight of stairs.
translation.ja: 口に銃を入れられたり 階段から蹴落とされたり

translation.en: Hunted ruthlessly through town.
translation.ja: 町中 追い回されたり

translation.en: And... I don't think I'll ever leave. I love it here.
translation.ja: でも この地を愛してるし 離れる気はない

translation.en: Before I moved out here, I worked in politics in Utah as a campaign manager and as a lobbyist.
translation.ja: ここに来る前は ユタでロビイストをしてた

translation.en: I got burned out on it pretty quick.
translation.ja: 嫌気が差してた

translation.en: I actually came here by accident.
translation.ja: ここに来たのは偶然

translation.en: Our car ended up breaking down in Garberville. And we needed to replace the starter in the Buick.
translation.ja: ガーバービルで車が故障して 部品交換が必要だった

translation.en: Got a job at the local Chinese place for...
translation.ja: 最初は中華料理屋で働いた

translation.en: well, pretty much the first day I was here. And, uh...
translation.ja: でもすぐに辞めたよ

translation.en: trimming job a couple weeks later. And the next thing you knew, I was up on the hill.
translation.ja: 数週間後には 大麻の収穫の仕事を始めてた

translation.en: Up until the '90s, we had your basic hippie growers in the hills.
translation.ja: 90年代までは少数の ヒッピーの栽培者がいるだけ

translation.en: We had a lot of ranchers. We still have the timber industry, the fishing industry.
translation.ja: 牧場経営者や 林業や漁業関係者が多かった

translation.en: This was a nice, artsy, quaint but industrial town.
translation.ja: 古風で情緒がある 産業都市だったよ

translation.en: But in the '90s, the population of these small communities in the hills went from,
translation.ja: でも90年代で 山奥の人口が60人程度から―

translation.en: you know, 50, 60 people up to a couple thousand.
translation.ja: 数千人まで膨らんだ

translation.en: We have 4,000 square miles of jurisdiction. And we have 15,000 illegal grows up here.
translation.ja: 約１万平方キロの区域に １万５千の違法栽培者がいる

translation.en: It is unbelievable.
translation.ja: あまりにひどい

translation.en: Greed has fueled this industry,
translation.ja: 強欲で業界が膨らみ―

translation.en: and that greed will continue to push people into violence
translation.ja: 人々を暴力沙汰に 巻き込んでく

translation.en: and to cutting their bottom line wherever they can.
translation.ja: 利益のことしか考えてない

translation.en: This is not the hippie marijuana industry anymore.
translation.ja: ヒッピーの大麻栽培とは 全然 別物だ

translation.en: You are taking your life in your own hands if you go up in these areas
translation.ja: 無許可の栽培者の元で 働くなら―

translation.en: and you work for one of these unpermitted growers.
translation.ja: 命の危険まである

translation.en: Any underground industry has its seedy side. That's why they call it the underground.
translation.ja: 裏社会なのだから 必ず危険はつきまとう

translation.en: You have people coming here with this idealistic view
translation.ja: それを理解せず 安全に収穫だけして― それを理解せず 安全に収穫だけして― ニック･アンジェロフ 歴史家

translation.en: that they're going to make some money for the entire year
translation.ja: それを理解せず 安全に収穫だけして― ニック･アンジェロフ 歴史家 ニック･アンジェロフ 歴史家 ニック･アンジェロフ 歴史家 稼げると甘い考えを抱き 来る人がいる

translation.en: by trimming marijuana in Humboldt County.
translation.ja: ニック･アンジェロフ 歴史家 稼げると甘い考えを抱き 来る人がいる 稼げると甘い考えを抱き 来る人がいる

translation.en: Well, they're putting themselves at huge risk.
translation.ja: 自殺行為に等しい

translation.en: And you could end up dead in a ravine. And it has happened, and it is happening,
translation.ja: 実際に死亡事件は 何回も起きてる

translation.en: and that's where we need to focus our law enforcement efforts.
translation.ja: 警察が対策に 尽力すべきところだ

translation.en: We need to figure out how to make this industry more safe
translation.ja: 大麻業界を安全にするため 努力すべきだ

translation.en: for the people who are involved in it. And I think legalization will provide that in the end.
translation.ja: 合法化は 安全性に貢献すると思う

translation.en: This area out in Alderpoint, there's zero police, there's zero protection.
translation.ja: アルダーポイントの一部は 警察も警備員もいない

translation.en: Everyone's out for themselves.
translation.ja: 自己防衛しかない

translation.en: You're putting up fences, you're having loaded weapons...
translation.ja: 柵を設置したり 銃を持ったり 柵を設置したり 銃を持ったり ロニー･ウィットロウ ハンボルトの住民

translation.en: um, and you got to feel safe, and that's the only way to do it.
translation.ja: ロニー･ウィットロウ ハンボルトの住民 ロニー･ウィットロウ ハンボルトの住民 自分で自分を守る 自分で自分を守る

translation.en: This is the Emerald Triangle: Trinity, Humboldt, Mendocino.
translation.ja: エメラルド三角地帯で アルダーポイントは―

translation.en: Alderpoint is almost literally in the epicenter.
translation.ja: ほぼ中心に存在する

translation.en: Alderpoint is a very unique area. So this is an area of southern Humboldt County... that...
translation.ja: アルダーポイントは 特殊な地域だ

translation.en: uh, that area, we refer to it as Murder Mountain.
translation.ja: マーダー(殺人)･マウンテンと 呼ばれる

translation.en: I was working on Murder Mountain before I ever knew it was called Murder Mountain.
translation.ja: そう呼ばれてると 知らずに働き始めた

translation.en: I don't know if you heard that name, Murder Mountain?
translation.ja: 聞いたことは？

translation.en: I think the name says it all.
translation.ja: 名のとおりだ

translation.en: Right over that mountain, Murder Mountain. Go down Bell Springs a ways,
translation.ja: あの山を越えると マーダー･マウンテンだ

translation.en: start seeing cars piled up on top of each other three and four high.
translation.ja: 車がいくつも 重なって放棄されてる

translation.en: All the serial numbers blasted off 'em with a torch.
translation.ja: 車体番号は焼いてある

translation.en: Who knows where the fucking bodies are at?
translation.ja: 死体もあるだろうな

translation.en: Murder Mountain is not a mystery.
translation.ja: ハンボルト郡 アルダーポイント 何も謎はない

translation.en: You go up there to work in a secluded area and do a risky trade
translation.ja: ハンボルト郡 アルダーポイント 隔絶された地で怪しい人々と 危ない商売をやる 隔絶された地で怪しい人々と 危ない商売をやる

translation.en: with risky, shady people,
translation.ja: 危険で当然だ

translation.en: and a lot of that property's changed hands so many times because none of the locals want to buy it.
translation.ja: 地元民は買いたがらないから 土地の所有者が頻繁に変わる

translation.en: So if you have money and you want to invest in this area, and you want to grow on it, you look for whatever's available.
translation.ja: 料金が手頃だから 他の土地が買えないから

translation.en: A lot of people will go there and buy it, 'cause it's either affordable or it's the only thing on the market.
translation.ja: ここの土地を買うヤツは そんな理由しかない

translation.en: You want an outlaw community, that's the Alderpoint area.
translation.ja: まさにアウトローの地だ

translation.en: I helped the sheriff's department with a shooting they had up there, the investigation a few years ago.
translation.ja: 数年前にあの地域の捜査で 保安官に協力した

translation.en: And I had not been up there in that vicinity since the '80s.
translation.ja: あそこには70年代に 行ったきりだった

translation.en: And just saw what it had become.
translation.ja: 様変わりしてたよ

translation.en: And I went up in a caravan of sheriff's deputies for this investigation,
translation.ja: 保安官代理の車に 乗せてもらったが―

translation.en: and in front of our column to the rear of our column I see guys jump out
translation.ja: バイクに乗った男が 目の前に出てきた

translation.en: in Enduro motorcycles with shotguns strapped to their backs.
translation.ja: 男の背中には 猟銃がかかっていた

translation.en: And I start to reach for my sidearm, and the deputy I was with assured me,
translation.ja: 銃に手を伸ばそうとする俺を 代理は制止した

translation.en: Don't worry about it. That's what they do. They're just escorting us through the area.
translation.ja: “いつものことだ 彼は案内してるだけだよ”と

translation.en: And I thought, Are you kidding me?
translation.ja: 冗談かと思った

translation.en: We're the police. What do you mean, they're escorting us?
translation.ja: 警察を案内するなんて ありえない

translation.en: They were working security for the marijuana farms there.
translation.ja: 彼らは大麻畑の警備員として 働いてるそうだ

translation.en: It was something else to see that that existed here, in America, in Humboldt County.
translation.ja: 他の地域では見ることのない 独特の文化だ

translation.en: It's their own law up there. It's their own country,
translation.ja: あそこには独自の法がある

translation.en: and they just kinda rule things how they rule 'em, run 'em how they run 'em.
translation.ja: 彼らが統治する別の国家だ

translation.en: It's like a surreal Mad Max scenario.
translation.ja: 「マッドマックス」の世界だ

translation.en: If you don't have protection from the law, you have to be the law.
translation.ja: 法の保護がないなら 自分が法になるしかない

translation.en: They have their own forms of justice,
translation.ja: 彼らの正義は 一般とは異なる

translation.en: because they live in the backwoods for a reason.
translation.ja: 理由があって 山奥に住んでるから

translation.en: It looks like pretty much everything's just been destroyed.
translation.ja: ほぼすべて破壊されたようだ

translation.en: This was my house. My cabin.
translation.ja: ここは俺の家だ

translation.en: Looks like what they didn't steal, they just broke.
translation.ja: すべて盗むか壊すかしてる

translation.en: Couple of guys we hired about two months ago.
translation.ja: ２ヵ月前に雇った連中だ

translation.en: I fired 'em, but I didn't think that was a big enough reason they'd totally fuck my life up.
translation.ja: クビにはしたが ここまでするとは

translation.en: Yeah, shit's all gone. Cloning room, lights, fans. Everything.
translation.ja: 照明や送風機まで 盗んでいってる

translation.en: I don't think we'll be back up and running for probably at least a month.
translation.ja: １ヵ月は 営業再開できないだろうな

translation.en: Maybe two months, which could cost... just about everything.
translation.ja: 復旧には費用もかかる

translation.en: The peace and love thing kinda went out with the '70s, and anymore it's...
translation.ja: 愛と平和の精神は 70年代で消え去った

translation.en: it's all about the power of the dollar, and pretty much everybody for themselves.
translation.ja: 今はカネの力だけが 物を言う時代だ

translation.en: If somebody does you wrong, you need to get 'em back.
translation.ja: やられたらやり返すしかない

translation.en: It's the last vestige of the Wild West.
translation.ja: 西部開拓時代のようだ

translation.en: - Clear. - Yeah.
translation.ja: クリア ああ

translation.en: We begged Garret not to go to Humboldt. But there was no talking him out of it.
translation.ja: ハンボルトに行かないよう お願いしたけどダメだった

translation.en: He had heard about a potential job to make a lot of money...
translation.ja: マーダー･マウンテンで 高収入の職を― マーダー･マウンテンで 高収入の職を― ボニー･テイラー ギャレットのおば ボニー･テイラー ギャレットのおば

translation.en: in what was called Murder Mountain.
translation.ja: ボニー･テイラー ギャレットのおば 見つけたと ギャレットは言ってた 見つけたと ギャレットは言ってた

translation.en: I'd first heard the name Murder Mountain
translation.ja: マーダー･マウンテンの 名は―

translation.en: from someone that Garret had communicated with on a regular basis.
translation.ja: 当時 息子と定期的に 連絡してた女性から聞いた

translation.en: And she said that she had already been up there to see him. She had gone to visit him,
translation.ja: その女性は山まで 息子に会いに行ってた

translation.en: and she said that Garret was in with a really bad crowd,
translation.ja: 息子は悪い連中と つきあってると言ってたよ

translation.en: and they weren't anything like Garret was used to.
translation.ja: これまでの友人とは 全然違うと

translation.en: She just was warning me. She was telling me that Garret's in danger.
translation.ja: 彼女は息子が危機にいると 警告してくれた

translation.en: You know, he has to get out of there as quickly as possible.
translation.ja: “一刻も早く出るべきだ”と

translation.en: Last time I saw Garret,
translation.ja: 最後に会ったのは―

translation.en: he had phoned me and said that they needed an SUV, a four- wheel drive up there.
translation.ja: ４ＷＤの車が欲しいと 電話で呼び出された時

translation.en: So we went car lot to car lot. We finally found one, and the one that he wanted...
translation.ja: 車売り場を巡って 最終的に欲しい車を見つけた

translation.en: - - I think it was a Dodge Ram.
translation.ja: ダッジ･ラムね

translation.en: He got in the truck. And I left him there at the parking lot.
translation.ja: 彼はトラックに乗って 私とは駐車場で別れた

translation.en: Another man is believed to be missing somewhere in the hills of Humboldt County.
translation.ja: ハンボルト郡の山で 29歳男性が行方不明に

translation.en: Today, the sheriff's office issued a press release asking for the public's assistance
translation.ja: ギャレット･ロドリゲス氏の 目撃情報を―

translation.en: in finding 29- year- old Garret Rodriguez.
translation.ja: 保安官事務所が求めています

translation.en: He is reportedly driving a 1998 Dodge Ram pickup truck.
translation.ja: 1998年のダッジ･ラムに 乗っていると思われます

translation.en: Anyone with information is asked to contact the Humboldt County Sheriff's Office.
translation.ja: どんな情報でも 保安官事務所にご連絡を

translation.en: So, you're at your residence. What do you notice? You said something about...
translation.ja: 家にいて 何に気づいたのですか？

translation.en: A bunch of cars, trucks, motorcycles, and off- road vehicles pass my place.
translation.ja: 車やトラックやバイクが 大量に通っていった

translation.en: I stay by myself. I'm an isolationist. Since Vietnam.
translation.ja: 私はベトナム戦争以来 人づきあいを避けてる

translation.en: I moved to the Redwoods to get away from civilization.
translation.ja: 世間から逃げるため ここに引っ越したんだ

translation.en: And I'm in no way involved with the crime.
translation.ja: だから絶対に私は 犯罪には関わってない

translation.en: I'll reiterate. If you've done nothing wrong there's nothing to worry about.
translation.ja: 何もしていないなら 責任は発生しませんよ

translation.en: Okay.
translation.ja: 分かった
